column4: i am still here without receiving any help. let me repeat for the last time? CAN ANYONE HELP ME CONFIGURE MY 3G MODEM WITH USB_MODESWITCH?
i remember that on Debian usb_modeswitch was NOT needed on newer (afair 2.6.32+) kernels
minaa: so, what kernel do you run? (uname -a to check) which version of Ubuntu (number please)?
zeik: i used chmod +x on it but it asks me for product id or device id for the 3g modem to be entered as parameter which i do not know
when i insert the 3g modem it shows up as cd drive on windows but it doesnt get detected as a cd drive either in ubuntu
afaics you run 2.6.35 kernel. most popular in Europe 3G modems should run perfectly even with bare bones wvdial
zeik: it is a hsdpa modem named visiontek
let me give u all a picture of the 3g modem
cool, i can't even check what chipset it has... manufacturer's website is down
the modem has a picture here http://images02.olx.in/ui/10/93/38/1293439681_151038538_1-Visiontek-3G-Modem-new-ones-for-sale-with-1Year-warranty-Vizianagaram.jpg
tried usb_modeswitch with several params but it isnt a sierra or huawei. the modeswitch software is probably made for those modems
zeik: cant it work in linux?
unreachable for me and/or down :( i'll check out picture you've linked to
probably the indian company is geoblocking users. what a bad policy
